me.waltster.Fantasy

Class PlayerMeta

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.waltster.Fantasy.PlayerMeta

  • public class PlayerMeta
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to provide a way to store and retrieve player information relating to the current game. Note that this is not static, and all unsaved data is lost when the server stops.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerMeta

        public static PlayerMeta getPlayerMeta(java.lang.String name)
        Fetch the metadata for the player by their name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player to fetch the metadata for.
        Returns:
        The metadata, or a blank object if not (inserts blank into map).

      • getPlayerMeta

        public static PlayerMeta getPlayerMeta(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        Fetch the metadata for the player by their object.
        Parameters:
        p - The payer to fetch the metadata for.
        Returns:
        The metadata, or blank object if not (see getPlayerMeta(...))

      • getRace

        public Race getRace()
        Get the race that the player is
        Returns:
        The race the player is currently playing as, or Race.NONE if none.

      • setRace

        public void setRace(Race r)
        Set the player's race.
        Parameters:
        r - The race to set for the player.

      • getKit

        public Kit getKit()
        Get the player's current class.
        Returns:
        The class the player is playing as.

      • setKit

        public void setKit(Kit k)
        Set the player's current class.
        Parameters:
        k - The class to set for the player.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Check if the player is in the game.
        Returns:
        True if the player is in the game, or false if not or otherwise.

      • setAlive

        public void setAlive(boolean a)
        Set if the player is in the game or not.
        Parameters:
        a - The value to set: true if alive, false if not.

      • setNeedsRevived

        public void setNeedsRevived(boolean n)
        Set if the player needs to be revived (30s).
        Parameters:
        n - The value to set: true if alive, false if not.

      • needsRevived

        public boolean needsRevived()
        Check if the player needs to be revived.
        Returns:
        True if the player needs to be revived, false if not.
